text: MATH312: Assignment 3 25 pts Oct 3, 2023 Due Date: Oct 11, 2023 1. . (i) (6,10,15), (ii) (7,11,13), (iii) (27,45,36). (2+2+3=7 pts) 2. Show that if a, b and c are positive integers, then ([a, b], [a, c], [b, c]) = [(a, b), (a, c), (b, c)]. Here (a1, a2, · · · an) denotes the greatest common divisor of the integers a1, a2, · · · , an and [a1, a2, · · · , an] is the least common multiple. (3 pts) 3. Determine the highest power of 2 that divides (i) 89,375,744 (ii) 41,578,912,246.(5pts) 4. (a) Determine if the following integers are divisible by 2. (2+2+2+1+3=10pts) i) (211102101)3 ii) (1112201112)3. (b) Determine which of the following integers are divisible by 3, and which are divisible by 5. i) (3EA235)16 ii)(10AB987301F )16. (c) Determine if the following integers are divisible by 17. a) (ABCDEF )16 b) (F 117921173)16. (d) Suppose that n = 31, 888, X74 where X is a missing digit. For what value of X is n divisible by 11? (e) Let n = 59, 358, 208. Determine which of the integers 7, 11 and 13 divide n. 1
